snippet: The notifications offer examples of the issues involved in Europe’s decision to allow individuals some control over what appears online about themselves.
abstract: Google notifies The New York Times that links to five articles have been removed from some search results on European versions of its search engine to comply with Europe’s 'right to be forgotten'; notifications offer vivid examples of issues involved in Europe’s decision to allow individuals some measure of control over what appears online about themselves.

byline.original: By NOAM COHEN and MARK SCOTT

lead_paragraph: The notifications offer examples of the issues involved in Europe’s decision to allow individuals some control over what appears online about themselves.

headline.main: Times Articles Removed From Google Results in Europe
headline.print_headline: Times Articles Removed From Google Results in Europe
